page.title: 02ETTINGTON PARK HOTEL
page.content: Ettington Hall was completed in 1862. It was originally the home of the Shirley family,one of the oldest families in Britain.They were able to trace their ancestors directly back to Saxon times.For the past hundred years it had been the property of the Underhill family, descendants of the Shirleys. The Hall is set in beautifully laid out park land with many stately cedar and wellingtonia trees.The River Stour runs through the grounds.Most of the park around the hall is used as grazing land for cattle and sheep.The hall is built in the gothic style with lots of turrets and towers.Around the outside is a frieze showing the history of the Shirley family. Inside the hall, now a hotel, has been carefully modernised, keeping the frontage in its original state.
